chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Maschil of Asaph.
items.plainText: Maschil of Asaph.

items.text: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?
items.plainText: O God, why hast thou cast us off for ever? why doth thine anger smoke against the sheep of thy pasture?

items.text: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.
items.plainText: Remember thy congregation, which thou hast purchased of old; the rod of thine inheritance, which thou hast redeemed; this mount Zion, wherein thou hast dwelt.

items.text: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.
items.plainText: Lift up thy feet unto the perpetual desolations; even all that the enemy hath done wickedly in the sanctuary.

items.text: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.
items.plainText: Thine enemies roar in the midst of thy congregations; they set up their ensigns for signs.

items.text: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.
items.plainText: A man was famous according as he had lifted up axes upon the thick trees.

items.text: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.
items.plainText: But now they break down the carved work thereof at once with axes and hammers.

items.text: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.
items.plainText: They have cast fire into thy sanctuary, they have defiled by casting down the dwelling place of thy name to the ground.

items.text: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.
items.plainText: They said in their hearts, Let us destroy them together: they have burned up all the synagogues of God in the land.

items.text: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.
items.plainText: We see not our signs: there is no more any prophet: neither is there among us any that knoweth how long.

items.text: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?
items.plainText: O God, how long shall the adversary reproach? shall the enemy blaspheme thy name for ever?

items.text: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.
items.plainText: Why withdrawest thou thy hand, even thy right hand? pluck it out of thy bosom.

items.text: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.
items.plainText: For God is my King of old, working salvation in the midst of the earth.

items.text: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.
items.plainText: Thou didst divide the sea by thy strength: thou brakest the heads of the dragons in the waters.

items.text: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.
items.plainText: Thou brakest the heads of leviathan in pieces, and gavest him to be meat to the people inhabiting the wilderness.

items.text: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.
items.plainText: Thou didst cleave the fountain and the flood: thou driedst up mighty rivers.

items.text: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.
items.plainText: The day is thine, the night also is thine: thou hast prepared the light and the sun.

items.text: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.
items.plainText: Thou hast set all the borders of the earth: thou hast made summer and winter.

items.text: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.
items.plainText: Remember this, that the enemy hath reproached, O LORD, and that the foolish people have blasphemed thy name.

items.text: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.
items.plainText: O deliver not the soul of thy turtledove unto the multitude of the wicked: forget not the congregation of thy poor for ever.

items.text: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.
items.plainText: Have respect unto the covenant: for the dark places of the earth are full of the habitations of cruelty.

items.text: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.
items.plainText: O let not the oppressed return ashamed: let the poor and needy praise thy name.

items.text: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.
items.plainText: Arise, O God, plead thine own cause: remember how the foolish man reproacheth thee daily.

items.text: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
items.plainText: Forget not the voice of thine enemies: the tumult of those that rise up against thee increaseth continually.
